results.title: Metformin Reduces Repeat Mild Concussive Injury Pathophysiology
results.text_hl: These studies suggest that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ may be beneficial as a treatment for repeat @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Concussion</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001924 @@@concussion@@@.

citations.NLM: Underwood EL, Redell JB, Maynard ME, Kobori N, Hylin MJ, Hood KN, West RK, Zhao J, Moore AN, Dash PK. Metformin Reduces Repeat Mild Concussive Injury Pathophysiology eNeuro. 2022 Jan-Feb;9(1):. PMID: 34903525
citations.BibTeX: @article{34903525, title={Metformin Reduces Repeat Mild Concussive Injury Pathophysiology}, author={Underwood EL and Redell JB and Maynard ME and Kobori N and Hylin MJ and Hood KN and West RK and Zhao J and Moore AN and Dash PK}, journal={eNeuro}, volume={9}, number={1}}

results.title: The Beneficial Additive Effect of Silymarin in Metformin Therapy of Liver Steatosis in a Pre-Diabetic Model
results.text_hl: Compared with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ monotherapy, the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@-@CHEMICAL_Silymarin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D012838 @@@silymarin@@@ combination reduced the content of neutral lipids (TAGs) and @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Concussion</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001924 @@@lipotoxic intermediates@@@ (DAGs).

citations.NLM: Hüttl M, Markova I, Miklankova D, Zapletalova I, Poruba M, Racova Z, Vecera R, Malinska H. The Beneficial Additive Effect of Silymarin in Metformin Therapy of Liver Steatosis in a Pre-Diabetic Model Pharmaceutics. 2021 Dec 27;14(1):. PMID: 35056941
